qas.question: What did the paper report that some fans did?

answers.text: picked the pockets of crushed victims

qas.question: Who was reported to have been assaulted while trying to help a patient?
What was the story based on?

answers.text: allegations either by unnamed and unattributable sources, or hearsay accounts of what named individuals had said

context: Under a front page headline "The Truth", the paper printed allegations provided to them that some fans <a0_0>picked the pockets of crushed victims<a0_0/>, that others urinated on members of the emergency services as they tried to help and that some even assaulted <a1_0>a police constable<a1_0/> "whilst he was administering the kiss of life to a patient." Despite the headline, written by <a2_0>Kelvin MacKenzie<a2_0/>, the story was based on <a4_0>allegations either by unnamed and unattributable sources, or hearsay accounts of what named individuals had said<a4_0/> – a fact made clear to MacKenzie by <a3_0>Harry Arnold<a3_0/>, the reporter who wrote the story.
